title: Spack thinks something is installed that was killed long before the install completed.
body:
$ ./spack install --dirty xsdk@develop+skiptrilinos
==> Installing xsdk
==> Installing petsc
==> Installing hypre
==> openmpi is already installed in /scratch/bsmith/spack/opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu12-x86_64/intel-16.0.3/openmpi-2.0.1-lryxkhida6aihfig3jorzoossiwkccdk
==> Installing openblas
==> Trying to fetch from file:///scratch/bsmith/spack/var/spack/cache/openblas/openblas-0.2.19.tar.gz
###### ################################################################## 100.0%

==> Staging archive: /scratch/bsmith/spack/var/spack/stage/openblas-0.2.19-opuuybyhyzuqhxyyz5jfttiwpkzuw2e7/v0.2.19.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /scratch/bsmith/spack/var/spack/stage/openblas-0.2.19-opuuybyhyzuqhxyyz5jfttiwpkzuw2e7
==> Applied patch make.patch
==> Building openblas
Terminated

```
  NOTE I put a control c here and kill the build because I did not want it to make openblas, this is   what caused the Terminated
```

/sandbox/bsmith/spack/bin (barry/develop _>) 
$ ./spack install --dirty xsdk@develop+skiptrilinos
==> Installing xsdk
==> Installing petsc
==> Installing hypre
==> openmpi is already installed in /scratch/bsmith/spack/opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu12-x86_64/intel-16.0.3/openmpi-2.0.1-lryxkhida6aihfig3jorzoossiwkccdk
==> openblas is already installed in /scratch/bsmith/spack/opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu12-x86_64/intel-16.0.3/openblas-0.2.19-opuuybyhyzuqhxyyz5jfttiwpkzuw2e7
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./spack", line 202, in <module>
    main()
  File "./spack", line 179, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 118, in install
    package.do_install(__kwargs)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1004, in do_install
    dirty=dirty)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1004, in do_install
    dirty=dirty)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 1004, in do_install
    dirty=dirty)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py", line 983, in do_install
    rec = spack.installed_db.get_record(self.spec)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 79, in converter
    return function(self, spec_like, *args, *_kwargs)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 527, in get_record
    key = self._get_matching_spec_key(spec, **kwargs)
  File "/scratch/bsmith/spack/lib/spack/spack/database.py", line 522, in _get_matching_spec_key
    raise KeyError("No such spec in database! %s" % spec)
KeyError: 'No such spec in database! openblas@0.2.19%intel@16.0.3+fpic~openmp+shared arch=linux-Ubuntu12-x86_64'
/sandbox/bsmith/spack/bin (barry/develop *>) 

So spack seems to believe openblas was installed based on just the fact it STARTED to install openblas, not that it was successfully installed. Then of course trouble because it wasn't installed.
